First Visit to Be'ati Hagosa

by: Tekle Derso - June 10, 2019
  • First Visit to Be'ati Hagosa Posted: June 10, 2019
  • Bus Drive from Mekelle to Adigrat Posted: June 09, 2019
  • Flight from Addis Ababa to Mekelle Posted: June 08, 2019
  • EEC Alumni Day Posted: June 16, 2017
  • The world of cats Posted: June 15, 2017

Monday, 10 June 2019 (ሰኔ ፫ ቀን ፳፻፲፩)

First Visit to Be’ati Hagosa

Askale had visited yesterday. But, her purpose was to pay her condolence on the death of Adey Kib’atu. So, today’s visit is a second for Askale while it is a first for me.

We had agreed with Askale to meet at Be’ati Hagosa at 8:00 am. I arrived there almost on time. I took the bajjaj to what they call Bar Lewahit, a location some meters down from what we used to call Tchegura. It might match the place where Ato Habtu died from lightening strike. From there, I walked to Be’ati Hagosa.

I took one kilogram of coffee (Birr 120.00) and gave it to Fana, Woldegebriel’s daughter.

Additional information, and maybe a Link or two
